message: It is our honor to introduce Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya who will lead the Office of Alumni Affairs and International Relations in the capacity of Dean henceforth. We aspire to take IIT Kharagpur to great heights under your leadership. We are thankful for the continued support of Prof. Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay who was instrumental in the formation and growth of IR Cell. Your dedication, energy and smile will always be an inspiration. Our best wishes for the coming year to all!!

*IMPORTANT INFORMATION*

Please note that the deadline for application to get the 'IR Recommendation' required for the NTU-India Connect Research Internship Programme is 26.12.2017(Tuesday).

NO MORE APPLICATIONS RECEIVED AFTER THIS DATE WILL BE ACCEPTED BY OIR.

Please visit Office of International Relations (OIR), in front of Central Library, Main Building, to get your recommendations.

Do you have an idea that can revolutionize mobility? Do you have an idea that can compete with the Hyperloop? If yes, here is your chance to showcase your talents. The French Embassy in India is organizing Easy Ride, a 2-day hackathon on the theme of smart and sustainable mobility. Easy Ride is a prototype and design competition that brings together teams of creative and ingenious students to come with innovative solutions on the theme of Smart and Sustainable Mobility. 
All the interested students are supposed to contact Mrs. Alivia Nag(alivia.nag@adm.iitkgp.ernet.in), International Relations Executive of IIT Kharagpur at the Office of International Relations. 
Please refer to the following link for more details: https://www.veltechuniv.edu.in/easy-ride/

Self Recommendation Letter | NTU-India Connect Programme

Since, we have been getting several requests regarding the self recommendation letter for NTU-India Connect Programme, in view of public interest, we suggest a few guidelines for the same. Self recommendation letter should have the following details:
1.Name
2.Year and department
3.Your competencies, achievements and awards
4.Your CGPA    
5.Your interests and why do you want to join NTU India Connect
   Programme

Please refer to the following link for a sample self recommendation letter: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ORdvW9-rzIUJehNpT5EEGICVpyhVgnDTlIiNy1FAkAQ/edit?usp=sharing

IR Cell presents you with Global Leadership Series, a unique series of interviews, discussions and guest lectures about leadership at the global stage. Today, we have with us Ranbir (Ron) Singh Gupta, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur from the batch of 1970, B.Arch. Ron Gupta is a top-notch architect in the US with his own company based in New York. Along with his wife, Chitra, Ron created the “Ranbir and Chitra Gupta School of Infrastructure Design and Management“ (RCGSIDM), first such school of its kind in the world. Here is a short discussion on his philosophy of giving back, objectives of the RCGSIDM School and some advice for the young entrepreneurs.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrIYXsEM11Q

S.T.E.A.M School - an interdisciplinary hands-on  education and problem-solving programme, based on United Nation's Sustainable  Development Goals is conducting a 10-day programme, an immersive  experience with a mix of project-based learning, field trials, mentoring  sessions and digital prototyping. Participants include students,  academicians, scientists, engineers, architects, doctors, environmentalists,  strategists and artists besides others in the creative economy.  This presents a unique opportunity for innovative and dynamic students to  interact with a different cohort of people involved in social purpose. IR Cell encourages every IIT Kharagpur student to participate in it. Follow this link to apply:  https://steam.makersasylum.com/school/

FT BLOG SERIES #203
International Relations Cell presents you with FT Blog Series wherein we share the experiences of several Kgpians who went on a Foreign Training in their past summers. We encourage everyone to go through it and find the perks of going on an FT. We advise everyone to have at least one global experience during their stay at this beautiful campus. We thank Nikhil Damle for the insights given and convey our best wishes for his future.
https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2FYes.ircell.wordpress.com%2F2017%2F10%2F08%2Fft-blog-series-nikhil-damle%2F&h=ATPtTFAVHVDD8eFsZdM5nQomtl1gEmkTwVQuNC6W22O4LMXS9BSm3nDZsZRrhBkcGxt1wySmjvh7rMeX_4TyyppAEuen3xv07uiENE08tbERqU6OZTE9eD8jGoG-EyPKfu-ZeFJhduXGKg

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared Hult Prize At IIT Kharagpur's video.
message: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared Hult Prize At IIT Kharagpur's video. The world’s’ largest student social entrepreneurial competition is back! Don’t miss out on such a golden chance to represent KGP on an international level and become a part of the elite club. HP 2017-18 is being organized in association with AIESEC IIT Kharagpur and Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur!

For all the women interested in technology, here is your opportunity to showcase your abilities:
Adobe India Women-in-Technology Scholarship
Through the Adobe India Women in Technology Scholarship, they are striving towards creating gender equality in the science and engineering domain by encouraging women to excel in computing and technology and become future leaders and role models in the field.
Deadline: 13th October, 2017
Here's the link for more details:
https://research.adobe.com/adobe-india-women-in-technology-scholarship/

For all the Graduate Studies aspirants who wish to apply at the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, here is an important fellowship to consider: JOAN AND LALIT BAHL FELLOWSHIP 
This Fellowship was created by a Kgp alumnus, Lalit Bahl (BTech, 1964, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur) 
It would help prospective students to secure a funded admission if they mention about this Fellowship while contacting tentative advisors and also on their SOPs. Please refer to the following link to know more:
https://www.ece.illinois.edu/academics/grad/fellowships/bahl

Aerial Robotics Kharagpur (ARK) participated in its second International Aerial Robotics Competition (IARC), in Beijing.The International Aerial Robotics Competition is the longest running collegiate aerial robotics challenge in the world. This time, team ARK performed remarkably better, grabbing the "Most Innovative Design Award" for their hexacopter named 'Falcon'.

To know more about the competition and ARK's performance read our blog-

http://wp.me/p7L0xP-6C

For all the IOT curious minds, here is your chance to meet and interact with Prof. Jeremy Watson, Chief Scientist at BRE. He will be delivering an IEEE Institute Lecture on "Petras a Research Hub for Cyber Security of the Internet of Things". He is the president of the Institution of Engineering and Technology, the largest multidisciplinary professional engineering institution in the world. 
Here are the details:
Date: 11th Sept., 2017 (Monday)
Venue: Maitrayee Auditorum
Time: 5 PM

FT BLOG SERIES #201
International Relations Cell presents you with FT Blog Series wherein we share the experiences of several Kgpians who went on a Foreign Training in their past summers. We encourage everyone to go through it and find the perks of going on an FT. We advise everyone to have at least one global experience during their stay at this beautiful campus. We thank Alok Anand Patra for the insights given. 
https://ircell.wordpress.com/2017/09/05/ft-interview-series-alok-anand-patra/

The Nobel Prize is widely considered the world's most prestigious award. Ever wondered how a Nobel Laureate is selected? How the process is designed? What distinguishes someone to win a Nobel Prize? Do you want to know more about the history and future of the Nobel Prize? Here's your chance!!! Institute Lecture by Prof. Sven Lidin on "The History and Future of the Nobel Prize"
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9RqplcrbMg

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 12 new photos — with Gyan Darshan and 8 others.
message: A Foreign Training and Research Talk was conducted by International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur. The talk witnessed enthusiastic students from all the departments. The panelists informed them about the general procedure to apply for a Foreign Training and told them about various programs. We wish best of luck to all the students applying for a Foreign Training this year!

It's an honour for us to meet the ex-chairman of the Nobel Prize Committee. We present you the excerpts from our discussion with Prof. Sven Lidin. It was an inspiring and engaging discussion where Prof. Lidin went to great length to describe what sets one apart, what is considered as world class research, how one can do great work and simply put: how one can get a Nobel Prize. He also talked about how India is rising and how Indians are contributing to research across the world. We encourage each and everyone to go through the interview description and get inspired.
https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6309412728322781184/

story: International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur added an event.
message:
International Relations Cell,  IIT Kharagpur presents Foreign Training and Research Talk for all those aspirants who dream to work abroad in a foreign university on a Summer Project.
Do not miss this chance of interacting with students from 3rd and 4th year who interned in various prestigious Universities last summer.
Tuesday, 29th August, 6:30 pm, V2
Date: 06:30PM
Time: 29-08-2017
Veunu: V2, Vikramshila

The details of the guest lecture are as follows:
Date: 25th August, 2017
Venue: Kalidas Auditorium
Time: 5:30 pm

On this auspicious occasion of the 67th Foundation Day of IIT Kharagpur, we convey our best wishes to every Kgpian across the world. In 66 years we came this far. We believe IIT Kharagpur will continue to inspire each and every one for all the glorious years ahead and play a constructive role in building a new and strong India. 66 years till now, in our hearts forever <3

Attn:   "All Master and PhD students of IIT Kharagpur"

Are you inspired to make an impact on the world? Do you  
believe all that it takes for a change is a great idea and an indomitable belief in it? If yes, here is a challenge for you:   An Indo-French "24H Chrono Entrepreneurship Challenge-India"!

A 24 hour challenge wherein 8 teams of 7 students each will elaborate a business model of enterprise/start-up, based on an innovative concept/product at IISER PUNE!

All Master and PhD students of IIT Kharagpur are encouraged to participate in this life changing challenge and get the best out of it. An official e-mail has been circulated among the students with all the details about the event.  

Hurry!!! Last date to apply : 22.09.2017

Interested  to know more ????  Please contact us through an email or call us at the earliest...

1.  Mrs. Alivia Nag, International Relations Executive, Office of 
     International Relations
     +91 3222-281068 (O) | alivia.nag@adm.iitkgp.ernet.in

2.  Raj Kolamuri, General Secretary, International Relations Cell
     9932190911 | raj1kolamuri@gmail.com
